questions.explanation:
7. Who's providing the floral arrangements for the party?
(A) The florist on Main Street. → Correct (identifies the provider of the floral arrangements)
(B) She's had a long career. → Incorrect (unrelated to the floral provider)
(C) Yes, his flight has been arranged. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

8. Why didn't you finish the budget report?
(A) At the finish line. → Incorrect (unrelated to the budget report)
(B) No, it wasn't expensive. → Incorrect (refers to cost, not the reason)
(C) I was meeting with a client. → Correct (explains why the report wasn't finished)

9. What floor are you going to?
(A) Can I have a copy of this? → Incorrect (unrelated to the floor)
(B) The twenty-fifth. → Correct (specifies the floor)
(C) That painting will look nice there. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

10. How do I set up this projector?
(A) The storage area downstairs. → Incorrect (refers to location, not setup)
(B) A new project code. → Incorrect (unrelated to projector setup)
(C) There's a manual in the drawer. → Correct (provides guidance for setup)

11. Who has already received their promotion letter?
(A) I did yesterday. → Correct (identifies who received the letter)
(B) A party invitation. → Incorrect (unrelated to the promotion letter)
(C) Polina gave the speech. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

12. Did you read the press release?
(A) I haven't checked my e-mail all day. → Correct (implies not having read the release)
(B) It's not raining here yet. → Incorrect (unrelated to the press release)
(C) The switch works fine. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

13. Didn't we renew our newspaper subscription last month?
(A) That photo's on the front page. → Incorrect (unrelated to subscription renewal)
(B) Here's the paper for your newsletter. → Incorrect (refers to a different context)
(C) Yes, it was renewed for another six months. → Correct (confirms the renewal)

14. When will we mention our budgetary needs to the outreach coordinator?
(A) I can't quite reach the top shelf. → Incorrect (unrelated to budget discussion)
(B) We're fully funded through the end of the year. → Correct (implies timing for budget discussion)
(C) Because our accountant is on vacation. → Incorrect (explains a reason, not timing)

15. My appointment is with Dr. Hamdy today, right?
(A) Usually an annual checkup. → Incorrect (refers to type, not confirmation)
(B) No, parking is not free. → Incorrect (unrelated to the appointment)
(C) Yes, and she'll see you in a minute. → Correct (confirms the appointment)

16. Where should I store this shipment of paper?
(A) The store closes at four. → Incorrect (refers to time, not storage)
(B) By express delivery. → Incorrect (refers to delivery method)
(C) Well, the supply room is full. → Correct (addresses storage issue)

17. Would you be able to reschedule my haircut for Monday?
(A) No, we're fully booked that day. → Correct (addresses rescheduling request)
(B) I'll open a window to let in some fresh air. → Incorrect (unrelated to haircut)
(C) The grass needs cutting. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

18. Should I take the train or the bus to the airport?
(A) The bus stop is five kilometers away. → Correct (provides relevant information for decision)
(B) There are enough for all of us. → Incorrect (unrelated to transportation)
(C) No, I went to a training session. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

19. How long will the online course take?
(A) You can finish it in a few hours. → Correct (specifies the course duration)
(B) Forty dollars a month. → Incorrect (refers to cost, not duration)
(C) I'll take the blue jacket. → Incorrect (unrelated to the course)

20. Will this month's company gathering be held in Benson Park?
(A) I usually park by the fountain. → Incorrect (refers to parking, not event location)
(B) It's still cold outside most days. → Incorrect (refers to weather, not location)
(C) Those should be printed in color. → Incorrect (unrelated to the gathering)
Note: No correct answer provided; correct answer should be, e.g., 'Yes, it's at Benson Park.'

21. When will the tickets for the performance be ready to pick up?
(A) We should get them by the end of the week. → Correct (specifies ticket availability time)
(B) A famous director. → Incorrect (unrelated to ticket pickup)
(C) Twenty-five euros. → Incorrect (refers to cost, not timing)

22. I don't know if the packaging materials were ordered already.
(A) I saw some boxes on the loading dock. → Correct (implies status of the materials)
(B) She's wearing a red hat. → Incorrect (unrelated to packaging materials)
(C) A lunch appointment at twelve thirty. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

23. Could you please send me the sales report?
(A) Fifty percent off last season's merchandise. → Incorrect (refers to sales, not the report)
(B) Of course-I'll do it now. → Correct (agrees to send the report)
(C) Did you check the weather report? → Incorrect (unrelated to the sales report)

24. What type of view will your apartment have?
(A) The kitchen lighting looks great. → Incorrect (unrelated to the apartment view)
(B) I haven't signed a lease yet. → Correct (implies view is not yet determined)
(C) We're in complete agreement on that. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

25. How much oil does your heater use in the winter?
(A) We may need to stop for gas on our trip. → Incorrect (unrelated to heater oil)
(B) That recipe calls for butter. → Incorrect (refers to cooking, not heater)
(C) We only use electric appliances. → Correct (implies no oil usage)

26. Where can I find the vitamins?
(A) In aisle six. → Correct (specifies the location of the vitamins)
(B) That's a really healthy recipe. → Incorrect (unrelated to vitamin location)
(C) The library is closed on Sundays. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

27. Thank you for helping me create a survey.
(A) The software did most of the work. → Correct (acknowledges the survey creation help)
(B) Our loyal customers. → Incorrect (unrelated to survey creation)
(C) The crates are still in the warehouse. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the survey)

28. When will you be done testing the new mobile app?
(A) No, just an older laptop model. → Incorrect (unrelated to app testing)
(B) I'm almost finished. → Correct (addresses the testing timeline)
(C) It's about a two-hour drive from here. → Incorrect (refers to distance, not testing)

29. Don't forget to turn off the projector after your presentation.
(A) I don't have a summary. → Incorrect (unrelated to the projector)
(B) Should I return it to the supply closet? → Correct (relevant follow-up to projector use)
(C) Please distribute these handouts. → Incorrect (unrelated to turning off the projector)

30. Didn't there use to be a parking garage on this street?
(A) Yes, but it's been torn down. → Correct (confirms the parking garage's status)
(B) You can hang your keys on this hook. → Incorrect (unrelated to the garage)
(C) My car has a flat tire. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

31. Will you be available to work on Thursday or Friday?
(A) There's mandatory training on Friday. → Correct (addresses availability indirectly)
(B) Yes, it was a good show. → Incorrect (unrelated to work availability)
(C) A daily schedule. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
